TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Network extends Urho.UrhoObject

Docs.summary: Network subsystem. Manages client-server communications using the UDP protocol.

remarks.para: Use the subsystem to start a server, or to connect to a server.
To start a server, call the method, to connect to a server, use the method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Network.Network which is tied to the .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.param: Pointer to the raw unmanaged Urho object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Network.Network, given a raw pointer to an unmanaged object

remarks.para: This creates a new managed wrapper for the type using the raw pointer to an unmanaged object.
Objects that are created in this fashion get registered with the UrhoSharp runtime.
This is intended to be used by the UrhoSharp runtime, and is not intended to be used by users.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Urho.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: The context that this object will be attached to.

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Network.Network linked to a specific .

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Empty constructor, chain to this constructor when you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.

remarks.para: This constructor should be invoked by your code if you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.
This essentially circumvents the default path that creates a new object and sets the handle and does not call RegisterObject on the target, you must do this on your own constructor.
You would typically chain to this constructor from your own, and then set the handle to the unmanaged object from your code, and then register your object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void BroadcastMessage (int msgID, bool reliable, bool inOrder, byte* data, uint numBytes, uint contentID = 0);

Docs.summary: Broadcast a message with content ID to all client connections.

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void PostUpdate(float32 timeStep) cil managed

Docs.summary: Send outgoing messages after frame logic. Called by HandleRenderUpdate.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RegisterRemoteEvent(valuetype Urho.StringHash eventType) cil managed

Docs.summary: Register a remote event as allowed to be received. There is also a fixed blacklist of events that can not be allowed in any case, such as ConsoleCommand.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SendPackageToClients (Urho.Scene scene, Urho.IO.PackageFile package);
.method public hidebysig instance void SendPackageToClients(class Urho.Scene scene, class Urho.IO.PackageFile package) cil managed

Docs.summary: Trigger all client connections in the specified scene to download a package file from the server. Can be used to download additional resource packages when clients are already joined in the scene. The package must have been added as a requirement to the scene, or else the eventual download will fail.
To be added.

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.

Docs.summary: Return the connection to the server. Null if not connected.
To be added.

remarks.para: The event can register multiple callbacks and invoke all of them. If this is not desired, and you only need a single shot callback, you can use the method. That one will force that callback and will ignore any previously set events here.

Docs.summary: Return whether the server is running.
Return simulated latency in milliseconds. Or Set simulated latency in milliseconds. This adds a fixed delay before sending each packet.
Return simulated packet loss probability. Or Set simulated packet loss probability between 0.0 - 1.0.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool StartServer(unsigned int16 port) cil managed

Docs.summary: Start a server on a port using UDP protocol. Return true if successful.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void StopServer() cil managed

Docs.summary: Stop the server.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Subscription SubscribeToClientConnected(class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.Network.ClientConnectedEventArgs> handler) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("SubscribeTo API may lead to unxpected behaviour and will be removed in a future version. Use C# event '.ClientConnected += ...' instead.")

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the ClientConnected event raised by the Network.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.
